result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: To Those Posting Cash Bond
to Those Posting Cash Bond - posted by JG
by JG at 2:35 p.m.

$6000 cash bond set on 1/31/22 amended to $3500 cash bond. All conditions remain the same: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

(Amended cash bond forwarded to the RCSD at 2:45 p.m. by email for Def's signature)
Adjourned initial appearance on February 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:11 PM Defendant Brian L Gardner appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail. Attorney Jeffrey M Ocwieja appeared by video means for Defendant Brian L Gardner. Attorney Jennifer M. Harper appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Def can't post 6k cash bond; states he can post 1k. DA notes the State originally asked for 10k cash. State persists in its request for substantial bond. Court reduces bond to $3500.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

1:08 PM Attorney Harper appears for the State. BG appears by video from the Richland County Jail. Court speaks about counsel. Attorney Harper indicates that Attorney Ocieja has a hearing in Dane County and request this be reset to tommorrow. Court resets for 02/04/22 at 1 PM

Conditions: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

Appearances: Judge Sharp, SKK Court Reporter, DA Harper/ADA Forehand for the State, Defendant by video in RCSD Jail with Attorney McDougal (this hearing only)

Recommendation on bail from the State :
$10,000 cash bond
Blood and urine on demand of law enforcement. 

Defense/Defendant comments:
Attoney McDougal states that the defendant doesn't qualifies for a public defender.

Attorney McDougal asks for a signature bond.

Court Orders:
$6,000 cash bond
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol and shall submit to evidentiary testing of blood, breath or urine, on demand of law enforcement, to monitor compliance. No entry into bars, taverns, or any establishment of which the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol, Phoenix Center included.

Next Appearance set for 02/03/22 at 1 PM

Court speaks about dean appointment.

Court reviews financial information and appoints Attorney Ocwieja. Defendant to deposit $50/month with the Clerk of Court starting on 03/01/22 . At the end of the case, counsel will file their bill and the Defendant will be required to fully reimburse Richland County. The Defendant will need to complete a payment plan form with the Clerk of Court.
